data.title: The Cranberries Press
data.text:
The American fast fashion company “Urban Outfitters” is selling 5 Cranberries t-shirts instore and online with international delivery available to 70+ countries. 3 for the US market and 2 for the UK/Europe market.

Just like the other fast fashion stores selling Cranberries tees, theirs are all for women and under license to Nylon Merchandising LTD as well… it seems the UK (London based) merchandising company has licensed a lot of Cranberries tees this year (and counting?)

US

The Cranberries Graphic Tee

Price: $39.00

The Cranberries T-Shirt Dress

Price: $45.00

No Need To Argue Tour Tee

Price: $35.00

UK

UO The Cranberries T-Shirt 1

Price: £35.00

UO The Cranberries T-Shirt 2

Price: £29.00

The American fast fashion company “Hot Topic” is selling 3 Cranberries t-shirts instore and online with international delivery available to 150+ countries.

Just like H&M, they are under license to Nylon Merchandising LTD and one-side print only… and still girls t-shirts (boyfriend fit).

“Paper Dolls” Red T-Shirt

From XS to XXXL

Price: $24.90

Thanks one more time to cranfandy for the info and pics (tag and instore)

“Zombie • 1994 World Tour” Black T-Shirt

From XS to XXXL

Price: $23.90

“Film Strip” Light Beige T-Shirt

From XS to XXXL

Price: $24.90

Thanks to Fairiris for the photo in real life (notice the very very light beige)

The Canadian clothing store Sirens/Urban Planet is selling a Cranberries t-shirt as well… unfortunately for Canadian residents only! It’s unclear whether you can buy it online only or in-store as well.

The Cranberries are part of the “Graphic Boyfriend T-Shirt” collection with the artwork/cover of “Zombie” and featuring among bands like Blondie, The Beatles, Metallica, Sex Pistols, Bon Jovi, The Rolling Stones… to name just a few. The collection is for women and pretty much in the same style of the H&M one. One-side print and notice the tag with the band logo!

Unlike H&M, their Cranberries tee has no copyright (just like most of their band shirts by the way), so we are not too sure this one is 100% official and under license. However, let’s note that the fashion brand is now quite big in Canada with 100+ shops across the country, hence we can’t imagine this t-shirt being a counterfeit one!

Color: White

Size: S to XL

Price: $16.00 (2 for $25)

Special thanks to cranfandy for the info and the last photo.

The full soundtrack for Netflix series “One Day” featuring “Dreams” by The Cranberries will be released on double vinyl on 25 October 2024 via UMR.

You can already pre-order it on Amazon UK

Price: £29.99

Last year, the Irish classical music radio station RTÉ lyric fm based in Limerick asked Fergal to compose a short piece to celebrate the station’s 25th anniversary in 2024. After hesitation and fear of not being able to do it, Fergal said yes… and soon after his very first piece for full orchestra “The Curragower Falls” was born (Fergal finished in late 2023).

Note: Curragower Falls is found in the heart of Limerick city under the shadow of King John’s castle. The falls are formed when the river Shannon drops over a rock ledge at the right tide. When the river is high the volume of water and the combination of low tide turn the falls into a freestyle playground. The waves are usually surfable 2 hours before low tide.

According to Fergal’s recent interview published on RTÉ Guide this week, the piece reflects on memories of childhood by the River Shannon, celebrates a city (Limerick) and memories of loved ones, including his father the late Myles Lawler who was a massive fan of classical and opera music, his mother Audrey who passed away at the end of January this year and the late Dolores O’Riordan…

“The Curragower Falls” will be performed on 1 May 2024 at the University Concert Hall in Limerick as part of the radio’s 25th birthday concert. Fergal won’t be performing that day, he was asked to but declined the invitation, hence he can relax, enjoy the show, and hear the piece for the very first time in concert from the audience!

It’s unclear whether the concert will be live or later broadcast on the radio; possibly live as there’s a mention “Listen, Lyric fm, Wednesday” on the top of the page of the RTÉ Guide interview.

EDIT (1st May): The concert is live broadcast tonight (Wednesday) from 7:30pm to 9pm. Listen here.

If you’d like to be part of the audience, more details, tickets, and performing artists on uch.ie

Special thanks to daffodillament1995 for the RTÉ Guide.

UPDATE – 2 MAY

Fergal yesterday at the 25th anniversary concert with Scarlett Griffin O’Sullivan (a musician? or someone from the audience?). Special thanks to her for the pics shared on Instagram

VIDEO: “A moment of appreciation for Fergal Lawler” shared on Twitter/X by @RTElyricfm

The 2 vinyls in real life, still the front covers we already know and no images of the inner discs and inserts yet. Published on Instagram by user @actionrecords and to be released on 20 April 2024.

UPDATE – 19 APRIL

There are 2 editions (US & EU) of Bury The Hatchet TCS so far. Exact same content.

The US edition has a UMe logo and the New York address. The European edition has a different universal logo and the Netherlands address plus a “made in czech republic” sticker.

Front sticker is almost the same on both editions, just a slightly different catalog number (plus or minus double zero).

First images of the US version were posted yesterday on ebay.com

US

EU

UPDATE – 20 APRIL

Unlike BTH it seems there is only one edition for AYL wherever you are in the world, a MADE IN GERMANY edition.

A rare interview with Dolores on the radio show “The Morning X” on 9 August 1999 was rebroadcast on the radio recently (22 March) during the “Best of The Morning X” and shared on YouTube by Cumulus Podcasts, the official account of one of the largest podcast networks in America. The podcast is also available directly on the official website 99xatl.com (look for March 22 – 18:09).

Description on YouTube mentions, “an interview and performance…” but only the interview (18min long) has resurfaced for now. Let’s hope for the performance to be rebroadcast as well!

To be released on 20 April 2024 for Record Store Day.

More info on recordstoreday.com

Tracklist

SIDE A:

1. Animal Instinct

2. Loud And Clear

3. Promises

4. You And Me

SIDE B:

6. Shattered

19. Paparazzi On Mopeds (Bonus Studio Track)

Notice on the image above the classic artwork for the first time on vinyl, since the original release from 1999 as well as the reissue by plain recordings in late 2015 were slightly different.

Seriously, who’s that girl? Not Madonna… and not Dolores for sure!

Below the cover of a new book/biography written in French, printed by Amazon (France) and released last month. Price: 11 euro. And yes the book really is about The Cranberries. Well…

CW is trying to let fans know everything about The Cranberries… everything… and this book is no exception so we had to mention it. We also never give our opinion as much as possible but this is a bit too much here and to make it simple: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!

This book, belonging to the “Culture Rock” series on Amazon France, is very possibly another AI shit, both the only one (fake?) photo and the whole text… even if we can’t confirm it. No author credited anywhere which is some kind of proof. Probably AI generated in 30 seconds just to make easy money like they did with many other artists for that series before. SHAME!

The online videogame “Fortnite” by Epic Games has a brand new game mode or place (or island in fact, that’s how the different locations/games seem to be named in the game) featuring The Cranberries. Sorry, we are not experts in that game at all, let’s hope we don’t say too much bullshit 🙂

That new island, just released a couple of days ago, is named “Fortnite Festival” and entering it is like playing games such as “Guitar Hero” or “Rock Band” where you have to play the notes appearing on the screen. Well… pressing the correct buttons in fact, nothing really close to real instruments… everyone knows that right?!

There are different layouts for the different instruments, alongside several difficulty settings, giving lots of replayability, etc…

“Fortnite Festival” has 30+ licensed songs and includes “Zombie” by The Cranberries

The base game “Fortnite” and the brand new one “Fortnite Festival” are available free on different platforms (MacOS, Windows, Playstation 4, Playstation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, Nintendo Switch, Android, iOS, iPadOS) and include in-app/in-game purchases.

Better than words, just have a look at this YouTube video, “Zombie” starts at 4:55:33

Tracklist:

Spotted on thesoundofvinyl.us The Cranberries first album (25th Anniversary Edition) to be released on gold vinyl in early December 2023. The limited edition is already available to preorder in the US (ships December 1) and as always should be available in more shops (and countries?) soon…

After the Dark Green LP last month, is this the start of a new color series just like it was the case for NNTA released in 10 different colors month after month during a couple of years!

UPDATE – 4 NOVEMBER

The band just announced it on their socials (Facebook, Twitter X, Instagram) with video teaser and pre-order link on udiscovermusic.com

Andy Janes shared for Dolores’ birthday on the Facebook group “Dolores O’Riordan And The Cranberries Collection” the never before seen video of “Sunday” recorded live during an instore special acoustic performance on 16 July 1993 at the Virgin Megastore in Hollywood.

Thank you so much Andy for witnessing and recording these extremely precious moments of the start of the fame for the band. PURE GEM!!!!!!!!!

Click the image below to play the video…

Note: Sorry for delay, we were waiting for Andy’s agreement to share it here on CW.
